mortality.note: Mortality driven by war and disease. The unique aspect is 'Epistemicide' (destruction of knowledge) via the Auto-da-fé of Maní (1562) where 27 codices and 5000 idols were burned.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Systematic destruction of Maya texts, temples, and religious practices. Auto-da-fé of Maní burned 27+ codices.
rationales.profit: Encomienda labor system, tribute extraction, land seizure for Spanish settlers.
rationales.ideology: Franciscan mission to eradicate 'idolatry' - religious conversion as explicit goal.
rationales.complicity: Spanish crown sanctioned cultural destruction; settlers benefited from indigenous labor.

analysis.pattern_note: A prime example of 'Epistemicide'. Shows that Ideology (Religion) combined with Profit (Encomienda) can lead to the total destruction of recorded history, distinct from biological extinction.

sources.title: Relación de las cosas de Yucatán
